solution_line_template: The first one runs a mile in {first_runner_pace} minutes because {first_runner_initial_time} / {initial_distance} = <<{first_runner_initial_time}/{initial_distance}={first_runner_pace}>>{first_runner_pace}

The second runs a mile in {second_runner_pace} minutes because {second_runner_initial_time} / {initial_distance} = <<{second_runner_initial_time}/{initial_distance}={second_runner_pace}>>{second_runner_pace}

The first one would finish {target_distance} miles in {first_runner_total_time} minutes because {target_distance} x {first_runner_pace} = <<{target_distance}*{first_runner_pace}={first_runner_total_time}>>{first_runner_total_time}

The second one would finish in {second_runner_total_time} minutes because {target_distance} x {second_runner_pace} = <<{target_distance}*{second_runner_pace}={second_runner_total_time}>>{second_runner_total_time}

It will take {total_combined_time} minutes in total because {first_runner_total_time} + {second_runner_total_time} = <<{first_runner_total_time}+{second_runner_total_time}={total_combined_time}>>{total_combined_time}
